description.narrative: Support to the education component, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Building Capacity For Evaluation, Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Education â€“ General, Evaluation, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 5: By the end of 2022, the most vulnerable preschool and school-age children, adolescents and young people, of both sexes, in the 10 targeted provinces make greater use of inclusive, quality educational services, for improved learning outcomes and receive certification for this.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: The education programme component was implemented with financial and human resources with technical skills in education policy and planning, early childhood development, pedagogy, budget management, as well as gender and equity. Skills in the areas of operations (supply, logistics and administration), communication, advocacy and partnerships have further contributed to the achievement of the results obtained. The implementation of the education programme also benefited from ongoing consultations with national partners, as well as other development partners, through the local education group. | Status:Met | As-of Date:24/01/2022
